text: A visitor looks at French painter Emile Bernard’s 1888 work Madeleine au bois d’amour (Portrait of my sister) at the Pont-Aven museum in western France. The museum, dedicated to post-Impressionist artist Paul Gauguin (1848-1903) and his followers who stayed in the small city of the Finistere from the 1860s, is reopening on Saturday following a three-year renovation.— AFP
title: Celebrating Gauguin
